What's the main reason why reset(this.value) does not always call update() itself?
In this case it would be convenient to keep the one line reset(this.value) instead of implementing something similar to reset locally.
What's the case when I would want to call reset() without calling update()? Should there be a short comment to explain this here?

In this case we cannot call reset() because it has a side-effect of clearing all validation errors we might just have received as a result of server validation.
Btw, I’m not sure here if we want to change the default form value at all after unsuccessful submit.
reset() does not always call update() because that results in duplicate updates with the value setter.
